title: Kelvin Fletcher out of running for Dancing On Ice as he continues Strictly
text:
Kelvin Fletcher ‘lined up for Dancing On Ice’ (Picture: BBC)

Kelvin Fletcher has stolen the show on Strictly Come Dancing, after replacing Made In Chelsea star Jamie Laing at the last minute.

However, despite owning the ballroom, it was rumoured that the Emmerdale actor also had his eyes set on Dancing On Ice.

A source told The Sun: ‘The door is still being left open for Kelvin to return to DOI.

‘He had been agonising for ages whether to take up the Strictly opportunity after being so far in advanced stages of talks with DOI.

‘But they still want him on the show for potentially the series after next.’

However, an ITV representative has since told Metro.co.uk that there is no truth to the claims.

He’s currently a favourite on Strictly (Picture: PA)

If the speculation was true, it would have only given the star 12 months to recover from Strictly’s glitz and glam before throwing himself back into the limelight.

Just recently the contestant revealed he’d ‘come to blows’ with his professional partner Oti Mabuse, just days before the next live show.

He said: ‘It’s been a hard week. A hard week.’

‘It’s been very emotional,’ the 29-year-old agreed, while Kelvin said: ‘We came to blows a few times…’

The couple received the first 10 of the series (Picture: PA)

Oti then added: ‘We got there in the end. And I’m excited.’

Kelvin is taking his Strictly stint seriously, in the hunt for this year’s Glitterball, and is hitting the gym at 5am four times a week to ‘keep the blood flowing’.

That’s on top of the 12-hour rehearsals the actor completes with Oti before they’ve even stepped foot on the dancefloor.

Well, he’s doing something right as he’s one of the firm favourites to lift the Glitterball trophy after consistently impressing the judges.

And he even managed to score the first 10 of the series with his Charleston

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday evening on BBC One. Metro.co.uk have reached out to ITV and BBC as well as Kelvin’s reps for further comment.
